result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neil B. Horwath

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Neil B. Horwath not in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Due to the non appearance of the DE court forfeits bond and issues $1,500 bench warrant.

DE appears late. Court quashes authorization of warrant and does not forfeit bond. DE states he has been in contact with Attorney Cafferty but needs a little more time to save some money.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. DE is not eligible for advocate counsel. DE states he would like time to get an attorney. STC set to 09/22/22 at 9:00.
Denied because the court finds the person is not indigent.
PFAC, Proposed Order and Letter all sent to Br 2

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: def turned in PE for APPT of ATTY; placed in CRML CLRKs bin
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Nicole B, JB,   *Not To Discuss Case w/ N.B. and J.B.

02:41 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am. $850  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
